I've never seen anything like it!${prompt}
That is the glow of plasma oil...${prompt}

That's correct.

A truly astonishing feat of technology.${prompt}

Ah, you've touched upon an interesting area.${prompt}

Any person with a basic knowledge of archaeology would recognize the graceful conical base and frail-looking central column.${prompt}
This design was often seen in the temples built during the reign of Emperor Alzadaal, some 900 years ago.${prompt}
The fascinating thing about these pillars lies in the construction itself.${prompt}
There are markings that suggest a degree of rotation and elongation is possible...${prompt}
Why would they make a pillar like that?${prompt}
Hmm, I wonder the same thing.${prompt}
I theorize that the architects of this structure wanted to incorporate a level of flexibility to compensate for the changes in water pressure...${prompt}
That's pretty clever...${prompt}
Should these technological marvels be understood in the near future, I hope to adapt their use to the field of automaton construction...${prompt}
Mister Ghatsad!${prompt}

The floor?
Yes, it really is quite fascinating.${prompt}
Ooh, I wanted to hear about this!${prompt}

It's a shame we've lost so many of the arts of that age...${prompt}

I'm sure I've seen this design somewhere before...${prompt}
Hmmm....${prompt}

The emperor of the time hoped to ease the suffering of his people and his nation...${prompt}
The candescence blesses all with its energy, regardless of station or wealth. It became a symbol of salvation.${prompt}
It is ironic that the candescence is now the catalyst for a new conflict, as the beastmen hurl themselves against our defenses time and again in an effort to claim it.${prompt}
The Astral Candescence is a national treasure that is set upon the Astral Plinth within Al Zahbi's Hall of Binding.${prompt}
Known as the “Astral Wind,” the infinite energy of the astral plane flows from this treasure...${prompt}
...uplifting the Empire's citizens and granting them courage.
